sentence.Network_en: He had been railed against by them as a prig and a poseur.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们责骂他是一个沾沾自喜、装腔作势的人.

sentence.Network_en: The transition from libertine to prig was so complete.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个酒徒色鬼竟然摇身一变就成了道学先生.

sentence.Network_en: You are neither a prig nor a bounder.
sentence.Network_cn: 你既不是道学先生又不鲁莽.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 淡淡的英文单词怎么写？-外语-天涯问答 ... pinch v. 拧，捏 prig n. 自命不凡者 pore vi. 钻研.
英语单词高手进_百度知道 ... plug 栓，塞子 prig 一本正经的人 prog (俚)训导员.
说话1_英语学习教室_新浪博客 ... pedagogy n. 教育学，教育法 prig n. 道学先生，自命不凡者 proctor n. 学监，代理人.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(P) ... priestly 僧的 prig 正经的人 priggery 自负.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: of unknown origin. The earliest sense was 'tinker' or 'petty thief', whence 'disliked person', especially 'someone who is affectedly and self-consciously precise' (late 17th cent.)

entry.tran: 道学先生；一本正经的人
entry.def: If you call someone a prig, you disapprove of them because they behave in a very moral way and disapprove of other people's behaviour as though they are superior.

means.word_mean: 1. a person regarded as arrogant and annoying

auth_sentence.content: He was no prig, but liked a laugh.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was no prig, but liked a laugh.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was no prig, but liked a laugh.

auth_sentence.content: Pennington, by his own account, was something of a prig.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pennington, by his own account, was something of a prig.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pennington, by his own account, was something of a prig.

auth_sentence.content: Webster may have been a prig, but he wasn't a duffer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Webster may have been a prig, but he wasn't a duffer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Webster may have been a prig, but he wasn't a duffer.
